name: Yellow Line Terminus East
design_style: Warm brick and timber construction with large, east-facing clerestory windows to catch the morning light
features: A community plaza with a farmers' market on weekends
Integrated bus loop with covered waiting areas
A digital art installation that changes with the time of day
Secure bike storage and a small bike repair station
function: Eastern anchor of the Yellow Line, serving established residential neighborhoods and connecting them to the city core.

neighborhood.name: Eastwood Commons
neighborhood.vibe: Established, comfortable, and community-oriented—a classic suburb with mature trees and a relaxed pace.

landmarks.name: Eastwood Public Library
landmarks.type: A modern branch library with extensive community programming

landmarks.name: Sunrise Park
landmarks.type: A large community park with sports fields, a playground, and a popular dog run

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Terraces
micro_neighborhoods.style: A mix of 1970s split-level homes and modern infill developments
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Weekend barbecues, quiet evenings, and a strong neighborhood watch program

name: Lakeside
design_style: Nautical-inspired design with white and blue tones, extensive decking, and a canopy shaped like a sail
features: An elevated platform offering panoramic views of the adjacent lake
Direct access to a public beach, marina, and waterfront promenade
Wayfinding signage pointing to boat rentals and waterfront restaurants
Public art featuring sculptures made from reclaimed boat materials
function: Serves a high-end residential district and a popular recreational lake, offering a resort-like atmosphere within the city.

neighborhood.name: Summit Lake Shores
neighborhood.vibe: Affluent, leisurely, and scenic—where city life meets lakeside living.

landmarks.name: Summit Lake Marina & Yacht Club
landmarks.type: A private marina and social club with public access to certain amenities

landmarks.name: The Lakehouse Restaurant
landmarks.type: A fine-dining restaurant with expansive lake views

landmarks.name: Waterfront Promenade
landmarks.type: A beautifully maintained walking and cycling path around the lake

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Shoreline
micro_neighborhoods.style: Large, modern lakefront homes with private docks and extensive glass
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: The sound of water lapping, weekend sailing regattas, and exclusive cocktail parties

name: Bulwinkle Boulevard
design_style: Mid-century 'Googie' architecture with swooping rooflines, neon signage accents, and terrazzo-patterned platforms
features: Restored vintage neon signs from the boulevard's heyday
Benches shaped like classic car fins
Historical photos showcasing the boulevard in the 1950s and 60s
A distinctive, quirky statue of a moose near the main entrance
function: Serves a unique and historic commercial corridor known for its vintage shops, independent businesses, and retro charm.

neighborhood.name: The Boulevard District
neighborhood.vibe: Nostalgic, quirky, and independent—a slice of mid-century Americana.

landmarks.name: The Starlight Bowl
landmarks.type: A vintage bowling alley and diner that has been in continuous operation since 1958

landmarks.name: Rocket Records
landmarks.type: A beloved independent record store specializing in vinyl

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Bungalows
micro_neighborhoods.style: Small, post-war bungalow homes on quiet side streets off the main boulevard
residents: Long-time residents who cherish the neighborhood's character
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: A strong sense of local pride, thriving small businesses, and community-led preservation efforts

name: Central Station
design_style: Cathedral-scale transit hall with arched glass vaults
features: Interactive ceiling map of Summit's transit evolution
Terraced ticketing concourse with sculptural light columns
Surround-sound boarding alerts in multiple languages
Dining promenade with micro-kitchens from all districts
function: Summit City's main light rail interchange and civic showcase. The bustling heart of the city's public transport network.

neighborhood.name: Civic Plaza Core
neighborhood.vibe: Monumental, multicultural, and perpetually in motion.

landmarks.name: Summit Grand Hall
landmarks.type: Civic event venue and historical monument

executive_towers.name: Summit Central Lofts
features: Direct elevator to transit mezzanine
Live-work zoning with panoramic boardroom lounges

name: Technology Park
design_style: Futuristic and minimalist with brushed metal, smart glass, and integrated fiber-optic lighting
features: Direct, climate-controlled walkways to major tech campuses
Wireless charging surfaces on all benches and tables
An abundance of quiet 'work pods' for commuters
Real-time shuttle tracking for corporate campus buses
function: Serves the city's primary technology park, home to major software, biotech, and hardware companies.

neighborhood.name: Summit Tech Corridor
neighborhood.vibe: Innovative, fast-paced, and highly caffeinated—a hub of ambition and technological advancement.

landmarks.name: Nexus Corp Global Headquarters
landmarks.type: A massive, architecturally significant tech campus with employee-only amenities

landmarks.name: The Innovation Forum
landmarks.type: A state-of-the-art conference and event center for tech industry gatherings

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Network Lofts
micro_neighborhoods.style: Brand-new, high-tech apartments with smart home features, designed for the tech workforce
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: A 'work hard, play hard' mentality, with luxury amenities and a seamless integration of life and work

name: Yellow Line Terminus West
design_style: Sleek and modular with clean lines, integrated solar panels, and a focus on efficiency and convenience
features: A large, comfortable co-working lounge integrated into the station
On-demand shuttle service to the Technology Park and local apartment complexes
Vending machines offering healthy snacks, drinks, and tech accessories
A large park-and-ride facility with numerous EV charging stations
function: Western terminus of the Yellow Line, primarily serving the residential communities where the city's tech workforce lives.

neighborhood.name: West Tech Village
neighborhood.vibe: Modern, convenient, and quiet—a suburb designed for the lifestyles of the tech industry.

landmarks.name: The Circuit Green
landmarks.type: A central park with walking paths, outdoor fitness equipment, and high-speed public Wi-Fi

landmarks.name: The Hub Retail Center
landmarks.type: A lifestyle retail center with a gourmet grocery store, high-end gym, and casual restaurants

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Byte-Sized Homes
micro_neighborhoods.style: A mix of modern townhomes and luxury apartment complexes with extensive amenities
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Quiet and family-friendly on the surface, but with a highly connected and tech-savvy population
